TopicTitle: please improve the wing shape and remove the big edges

Articles.Content:
hey squad i love the new wing parts but i have a problem i keep on running in to.

and that is the different edge sizes.

an example:

the type B wing has a wider edge than the type A wing. (see picture)

when you put the wings under a angle like this

thats ugly as hell and more parts have that problem.

please make all the egde's smal so the dont stick out.

thanks in advanced.

reaper.

(do you also think the edge's should be the same shape, leave a comment)

They also need to properly centre the structural wing. When SP+ was integrated someone, god knows why, decided to leave it a uncentered as before.

>example image if I don't forget.

They should also carry out your suggestion.

Those wings just generate lift when the thicker edge is pointing towards (and against, maybe?) the air speed vector. The flat edge is for attaching more wing sections. If it werent like that, the Structural A and B would be only one section (as they are the same, but rotated 90 degrees) of wing. I don't know the design reasons for that (it seems it has to do with stock aerodynamics handling), but if the leading edges were removed we would have a lot of styrofoam planks lying around (visually, at least). On the other hand, the leading edges visually help to know what direction should they face to generate lift.

They look nice for spaceplanes when used normally, so I don't complain on their looks. The attachment points in the wings for non-wing parts on the other hand...
i personally dont care if they make the edges smaller OR larger, so long as they bloody match. you are right, its ugly as hell. as they say, its a $100 move with a 10 cent finish.
